detaileddescription.para:
For each cell of the console, this function:
sets the background color to the default background color
sets the foreground color to the default foreground color
sets the character to space (ASCII 32)

parameterdescription.para: The effect to apply to background

simplesect.para: The current character at the position

briefdescription.para: Modify a cell in the console.

detaileddescription.para:
At the specified position, this function:
sets the background color thanks to the effect and the default background color
sets the foreground color thanks to the default foreground color
sets the character to a new value

parameterdescription.para: The effect to apply to the background

memberdef.argsstring: (Vector2i position, char16_t c, const Color4f &foreground, const Color4f &background)
memberdef.name: putChar

briefdescription.para: Modify a cell in the console.

detaileddescription.para:
At the specified position, this function:
sets the background color to the specified color
sets the foreground color to the specified color
sets the character to a new value
This function uses the default values for background color, foreground color, console effect and alignment.

The specified position indicates:
The first character of the string if the alignment is gf::ConsoleAlignment::Left
The center character of the string if the alignment is gf::ConsoleAlignment::Center
The last character of the string if the alignment is gf::ConsoleAlignment::Right

memberdef.argsstring: (Vector2i position, ConsoleEffect effect, ConsoleAlignment alignment, const char *fmt,...)
memberdef.name: print

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the default values for background color, foreground color but uses the specified console effect and alignment.

The specified position indicates:
The first character of the string if the alignment is gf::ConsoleAlignment::Left
The center character of the string if the alignment is gf::ConsoleAlignment::Center
The last character of the string if the alignment is gf::ConsoleAlignment::Right

parameterdescription.para: The effect to apply to the background

detaileddescription.para: The string is split in paragraphs according to new lines and then split in lines to fit the width of the specified rectangle. If the specified height is reached, the string is truncated. I the height is 0, then the string is truncated at the bottom of the console.

parameterdescription.para: The rectangle to print the string

simplesect.para: The height in console lines of the printed string

memberdef.argsstring: (const RectI &rect, ConsoleEffect effect, ConsoleAlignment alignment, const char *fmt,...)
memberdef.name: printRect

detaileddescription.para: The string is split in paragraphs according to new lines and then split in lines to fit the width of the specified rectangle. If the specified height is reached, the string is truncated. I the height is 0, then the string is truncated at the bottom of the console.

parameterdescription.para: The rectangle to print the string
The effect to apply to the background

simplesect.para: The height in console lines of the printed string

briefdescription.para: Get the expected number of console lines of a multi-line formatted string.

detaileddescription.para: This function does not print anything, it only computes the number of lines that a formatted string would take if it was printed with printRect()

parameterdescription.para: The rectangle to print the string

briefdescription.para: Set a color for color control.

detaileddescription.para: Color control codes allow to change color in a string on the fly. There are five color control codes: gf::ConsoleColorControl1, gf::ConsoleColorControl2, gf::ConsoleColorControl3, gf::ConsoleColorControl4 and gf::ConsoleColorControl5. Each one is associated with a foreground and a background color that you can set with this function. The color control code gf::ConsoleColorControlStop changes the colors back to their default.
This function fills the specified rectangle with the default background color. If the print action is gf::PrintAction::Clear, then the characters inside the rectangle are set to space (ASCII 32).

parameterdescription.para: The rectangle to print the rectangle
The effect to apply to the background

detaileddescription.para: This function draws a horizontal line using gf::SpecialChar::WallHorizontalLine.

parameterdescription.para: The left end point of the line
The effect to apply to the background

detaileddescription.para: This function draws a vertical line using gf::SpecialChar::WallVerticalLine.

parameterdescription.para: The top end point of the line
The effect to apply to the background

memberdef.argsstring: (const RectI &rect, PrintAction action=PrintAction::None, ConsoleEffect effect=ConsoleEffect::Default, const char *title=nullptr,...)
memberdef.name: drawFrame

detaileddescription.para: This funtion first draws a rectangle using the specified action and effect. Then it draws a frame. If a title is given, it is printed on the top of the frame with inverted colors.

parameterdescription.para: The rectangle to print the rectangle
The effect to apply to the background
The format string of the title
The fading amount, with 0 meaning the fading color and 1 meaning no fading

briefdescription.para: Fill the area with space characters.

parameterdescription.para: The size of the console, in characters

briefdescription.para: Get the width of the console.
Get the height of the console.

memberdef.argsstring: (const RectI &src, Console &con, Vector2i dst, float foregroundAlpha=1.0f, float backgroundAlpha=1.0f) const
memberdef.name: blit

briefdescription.para: Blit a console on another console.

parameterdescription.para: The source rectangle on the source console
The destination position on the destination console
The alpha of the blitted console foreground color, 0 is a completely transparent source console and 1 is a completely opaque source console
The alpha of the blitted console background color, 0 is a completely transparent source console and 1 is a completely opaque source console

briefdescription.para: Draw the object to a render target.

detaileddescription.para: This is a pure virtual function that has to be implemented by the derived class to define how the drawable should be drawn.

memberdef.argsstring: (Vector2i position, ConsoleEffect effect, const std::u32string &message, const Color4f &foreground, const Color4f &background)
memberdef.name: putWord

memberdef.argsstring: (const RectI &rect, ConsoleEffect effect, ConsoleAlignment alignment, const std::string &message, PrintOptionFlags flags=None)
memberdef.name: printInternal

detaileddescription.para: A console is a virtual terminal where you can print the characters from a console font. Each cell of the console has a background color, a foreground color and a 8-bit character.

A console has a state with default values for different aspects:
a default background color (initiallly gf::Color::Black)
a default foreground color (initiallly gf::Color::White)
a default console effect (initiallly gf::ConsoleEffect::None)
a default alignment (initiallly gf::ConsoleAlignment::Left)
Several functions use this state to determine actual values.
